body: Little is known of Ruth Clark's art training and there is very little biographical information available, other than that she was in Alameda, California in 1912.  That Clark was a talented artist cannot be questioned.  This painting illustrates her skill in compositionÃ¢ÂÂhorses rendered in exquisite detail.  The background contains a delightful accent--a mule, also painted in exacting detail.
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 22.5 x 30 inches / Signed lower right
